Class NewPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • NewPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IPlayer

    public class NewPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IPlayer
    Implementation of a Least-Mean-Squares (LMS) algorithm for a 5x5x5 Tic-Tac-Toe game
    Author:
    Tilman Krokotsch, 199917, Tim Sabsch, 200088 date: 11-03-2014

      updates the feature list using the number of markers in a line and the occupying player
      private void updateWeights(de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IBoard board)
      updates the weights using the formula wi = wi + eta * xi * error for each step of the game, where eta is the learning rate, xi are the different features and error is the difference between the training example value and the learned value The training example value is set as the successive learning value.

      • computeValue

        private double computeValue(int[] features)
        computes V(x1,x2,...,x8) = w1*x1 + w2*x2 + ... + w8*x8
        Parameters:
        features - the x values (which are representing the different features)
        Returns:
        the result of V(x1,...,x8)

      • computeValueAtPosition

        private double computeValueAtPosition(de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IBoard board,
                            int x,
                            int y,
                            int z)
        computes the current feature values. Then it computes the feature values we would obtain, if we make a move at position {x,y,z}.
        Parameters:
        board - the current board state
        x - the x position we inspect currently
        y - the y position we inspect currently
        z - the z position we inspect currently
        Returns:
        the difference between the current feature sum and the future feature sum

      • getFeatures

        private int[] getFeatures(de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IBoard board)
        checks all possible lines and returns a feature list of this form: [ x1, x2, x3, ..., x8], where x1-x4 are the number of unblocked single/double/... markers in a line of our own player and x5-x8 the numbers of unblocked single/double/... markers in a line of the enemy
        Parameters:
        board - a board state
        Returns:
        an array containing the feature list of the board state

      • updateFeatureResult

        private int[] updateFeatureResult(de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IPlayer player,
                        int[] result,
                        int count)
        updates the feature list using the number of markers in a line and the occupying player
        Parameters:
        player - the occupying player
        result - the current feature list
        count - the number of markers in a line
        Returns:
        the updated feature list

      • checkFieldOccupier

        private de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IPlayer checkFieldOccupier(de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IPlayer occupier,
                                                               de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IPlayer player)
                                                                  throws NewPlayer.InvalidLineException,
                                                                         NewPlayer.NotOccupiedException
        checks, which player occupies the current field
        Parameters:
        occupier - the current occupier of the field
        player - the former line holder
        Returns:
        the (new) line holder
        Throws:
        NewPlayer.InvalidLineException - if the line contains marker of two different player
        NewPlayer.NotOccupiedException - if the field is not occupied

      • updateWeights

        private void updateWeights(de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IBoard board)
        updates the weights using the formula wi = wi + eta * xi * error for each step of the game, where eta is the learning rate, xi are the different features and error is the difference between the training example value and the learned value The training example value is set as the successive learning value. To get the feature example of each step, we reconstruct the board state and compute the features.
        Parameters:
        board - the final board state

      • reconstructFeatures

        private de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IBoard reconstructFeatures(de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IBoard board,
                                                               java.util.List<de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api.IMove> history)
        reconstructs the board state using a movement history
        Parameters:
        board - a board state
        history - a movement list
        Returns:
        a board containing the moves of history
